description: From Middle English, from Old French desmembrer, from des- (“de-”) + membre (“limb”) + -er (“verbal suffix”).

verbs.description: dismember (third-person singular simple present dismembers, present participle dismembering, simple past and past participle dismembered)

examples: Death by drawing and quartering usually dismembered the condemned person.

entries.meaning: (transitive) To cut or otherwise divide something into pieces.
examples: The killer methodically dismembered the bodies of his victims.
The American Civil War nearly dismembered the Union.
